definition: ready to take any job, high or low
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
surname Neng
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
surname Neng
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: The child tugged at my arm to attract my attention.
sentences.chinese: 那孩子拉我的胳臂以能上能下引起我的注意。

sentences.english: A cadre should be ready to take a lower as well as a higher post.
The third character is a card, can go up or down.
sentences.chinese: 第三個字是卡，能上能下。

definition: expert at appointing people according to their abilities (idiom)/to put the right people in the right places
to appoint people according to their merits (idiom); appointment on the basis of ability and integrity
not stick to one pattern
employ one's talent to the fullest/everyone gives of their best
incentive mechanism/motivation method
having both integrity and talent (idiom)
to delegate power/to decentralize
top-notch efficiency
can bow and submit, or can stand tall (idiom, from Book of Changes); ready to give and take/flexible
can bow and submit, or can stand tall (idiom, from Book of Changes); ready to give and take/flexible
work more and get more
multi-talented person/versatile person/all-rounder
to adapt to circumstances
lit. if he orders you go, he forbids you stop (idiom); fig. to demand exact compliance with instructions/to ensure strictly obedience
to recognize talent
lit. every turnip to its hole (idiom)/fig. each person has his own position/each to his own/horses for courses/every kettle has its lid
